ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Codes representing the type of data file record.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes. Household is a common unit for classifying population data.

Concepts.definition: A social unit comprised of one or more individuals living together (all of whom need not be related) in the same dwelling, who aggregate and share their incomes.
A human being.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.:A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:A human who has reached reproductive age.

Concepts.definition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.: A human who has reached reproductive age.: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.:A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:A person who is not yet an adult.  The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.

Concepts.definition: Governed by or depending on chance; lacking any definite plan or order or purpose.
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.
An age group comprised of individuals who are not yet an adult. The specific cut-off age will vary by purpose.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.: A noteworthy happening that is distinctive in a series of related events.

Concepts.definition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
A noteworthy happening that is distinctive in a series of related events.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.: A noteworthy happening that is distinctive in a series of related events.: In precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker.

A noteworthy happening that is distinctive in a series of related events.
In precisely the same words used by a writer or speaker.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.

Concepts.definition: A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
